title: Expression for the magnitude of force

content.description: A box of mass <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is pulled to the right at constant speed across a rough, horizontal surface. Two ropes are used to exert forces <math alttext="vector F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="vector F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> on the box. <math alttext="vector F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is horizontal and to the left, and <math alttext="vector F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is at an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> above the horizontal, as shown. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the box and the horizontal surface is <math alttext="mu" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: Which of the following is a correct expression for the magnitude of force <math alttext="vector F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>→</mo></mrow></mover></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub 2, times the cosine of theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>cos</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi></math>

<math alttext="mu times, open parenthesis, M g minus, F sub 2, times the sine of theta, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>μ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>sin</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="F sub 2, times the cosine of theta, minus, mu times, open parenthesis, M g minus, F sub 2, times the sine of theta, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>cos</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>μ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>sin</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="F sub 2, times the cosine of theta, plus, mu times, open parenthesis, M g minus, F sub 2, times the sine of theta, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>cos</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>μ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>sin</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="F sub 2, times the sine of theta, minus, mu times, open parenthesis, M g minus, F sub 2, times the cosine of theta, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>sin</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>μ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>cos</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub 2, times the cosine of theta, minus, mu times, open parenthesis, M g minus, F sub 2, times the sine of theta, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>cos</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>μ</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>M</mi><mi>g</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>sin</mi><mo> </mo><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
